page.title: 11GOOSTREY SCHOOL_CHANGES
page.content: There has been a school in Goostrey since the early seventeenth century. The present building was built in 1856 and remained relatively unchanged for many years.One of the local farmers remembers attending the school in the 1950's when there was just the old part with its pointed gables,high ceilings, and windows deliberately placed above eye level. As the village population grew,the school was extended. In the late 1960's still more space was needed so temporary classrooms were put in the playground. The situation was resolved in the early 1970's by the building of a combined Infant School and village hall. The school is now on a split site with the Junior department in the old building and Infant classes "across the road and round the cow field".
